intro: Pourretia sympaganthera, commonly known as the golden crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its striking yellow ray florets and dark purple disk flowers, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, known for its composite flower heads. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening due to its vibrant color and drought tolerance.
